title: New transport links boost business and tourism for Hong Kong and Pearl River Delta
text: Hong Kong's new high-speed train station, along with the new Hong Kong–Zhuhai–Macao bridge, have slashed travel times for millions of people throughout China’s Pearl River Delta region. It's changed the lives of commuters, business people and tourists alike. In this edition of Spotlight, we explore this new ultra-modern transport matrix and its impact on the region. We speak with some of the people who designed, built and operate the state-of-the-art infrastructure, and gauge the potential impact on the tourist business.
description: New transport links boost business and tourism for Hong Kong and Pearl River Delta
